text: [Music]
hi under in a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Bangalore
India today I'm going to show you how to
create a DHCP options set for your AWS
directory let's get started by default
Amazon VPC uses AWS DNS instead of a
directory service DNS however it's a
best practice that customers create
their own DHCP option sets for their AWS
directory and then use this set with the
V PC that the directory runs in a DHCP
options that provides a standard for
passing configuration information to
hosts this configuration contains
information such as domain name domain
name server NTP servers and so on
assigning the set to the V PC allows any
instances in that V PC to point to the
specified domain and to resolve the
domain names as you can see I'm already
logged in to my AWS management console
open the Amazon new PC console
choose DHCP option sets in the
navigation pane and then choose clear
DHCP options
when the dialog box appears enter an
optional name tag for the set
enter the fully qualified domain name
for the directory enter the IP addresses
of the directories DNS servers these are
the IP addresses of your AWS provide a
directory to find the IP addresses of
the directory you want open the type to
services console
in the delivery section choose the ID of
the directory you want
you can find the IP addresses under the
DNS address section
you can leave the rest of the fields
blank choose clear DHCP option set
you'll see the new set in the list on
DHCP option set
not the idea of the set as you will need
that idea to associate with the we
proceed
navigate to the VP see you want from the
your VP C's option in the navigation
pane
select the VPC choose actions and then
choose edit DHCP options set select the
desired option set from the list and
choose save
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
